div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Feb. 20, 1894 POLISH POLITICAL ACTIVITIESPolish Young Men's Democratic Club of the 15th Ward Meets

body.p: We have been requested to publish the following report in our newspaper:

Last Sunday the Poles of the 15th Ward held one of their largest political meetings. Approximately three hundred persons attended the gathering, which was held at Columbia Hall by the Polish-American youth of the 15th Ward.

Of the many speakers who addressed the gathering, the most energetic ones were John Nowicki, S. Fruzyna, and J. B. Pallasch, our candidate for alderman of the 15th Ward, all of whom spoke in Polish. . Sarazinski, who desires to run for the post of clerk of West Town, spoke in English Francis Cutowski spoke in German.

After the speeches, the public chose a campaign committee, whose duty will be to work very energetically in behalf of the candidacy of John S. Pallasch
for alderman. This committee consists of J. Nowicki, J. Krajecki, S. Fruzyna, F. Klatecki, F. Gutowski, ielichowski, and M. Sarazinsi.
